introduction: Packaging, protection and conservation solutions for the Agri-food sector
title: Plastag
description: We are one of Australia's largest distributors of grain bags, silage wrap, covers, oxygen barrier film, greenhouse films, flexitanks, twine, netwrap and silage/hay ...
paragraph_text: At Plastag, we specialise in packaging, protection and conservation solutions for the Agri-food sector across Australia.
Find out more about our products
© Plastag Pty Ltd. All rights reserved.
Engineered for Australian Livestock and Production Systems
Anti Slip            Easy Wash           Long Life
Scroll down to request a free sample of our Matox Livestock Mat
"We're saving around 15 minutes on every milking due to improved cow flow. In addition, wash down time and water use has declined dramatically
The significant reduction in lameness and slipovers has seen herd health and production improve".
Justin Rendell, Australian Consolidated Dairies, Kyabram
Milking 850 cows twice per day, and an elite herd of 400 cows, three times a day
"We've tried a lot of mats, and find this mat extremely durable, high grip, easy to wash, and soft underfoot".
Bruce and Sam Holloway, Mepunga, Western Districts, Vic

© Plastag Pty Ltd. All rights reserved.
Hyti Silage Covers & O2 Barrier Film
Choosing a high quality, 3% UV stabilised film is critical to the silage making process and outcome.
Hyplast silage covers and our NEW 'Hyti-Barrier' oxygen barrier plastic underlay film ensures high quality fodder conservation every time.
All silage films consist of 3 layers (co-extrusion technique) and made in Belgium for Australian conditions.
High oxygen film barrier allowing for a complete fermentation and preservation of stored feed nutrients.
Produced with the strongest and most durable film resins and can withstand the harshest of storage conditions in Australia and NZ.

A high level of  ultraviolet high light protection (3%) and are warranted for 18 months towards UV degradation. Vital in Australia's high UV environment. Rated to 180 UV Kilo langley - Highest in the World!
White outside layer helps to keep stored silages cooler, reducing bunker heating and the DM losses.
Hyti Barrier high oxygen barrier film - 'The complete quality package'
Hyti Barrier was developed specifically to enhance the quality of bulk silage around the world.
The success of this product in the USA and Europe has now made its way to Australia!
The high oxygen barrier film features:
50 times less oxygen permeability than standard black/white silage film.
The 50 micron underlay film is tough and durable.

The film follows contours of the silage, sucking down to create a fully anerobic environment in the bunker/pit. Thus reducing dry matter loss and animal health issues associated with undesirable microrganisms & mycotoxins.

4) Submit the full completed online Claim form no later than 11.59pm (AEST) on 31/11/2108. Please be aware claim registrations will not be accepted after this date.

In order to validate your purchase, please send a copy of your paid receipt to
Important - No claims will be processed without confirmation of proof of purchase.
© Plastag Pty Ltd. All rights reserved.
How long do you have to make a claim?
You have until the end of the registration period which ends on 11.59pm AEST on 31/11/2018
It is a $50 Coles Myer Gift Card
Payment in full of the participating product within the promotional period
To participate, you need to order 4 rolls of Rondotex Wet Wrap from a participating retailer.
Should I register my claim is I have only paid a deposit on my Participating Product?
No, you should pay for your participating product in full within the promotional period before registering your claim form.  We do not accept tax invoices sent by post or facsimile.
How do I know if my claim has been approved?
You will be sent an "Approved Claim" email notification of advise that your claim has been approved.
What happens if I do not have an email address?
In order to participate in this offer, you need a valid email address.  If you do not have one, you will need to create one.
How long will it take to receive my gift card?
Please allow up to 12 weeks delivery from the date of the "Approved Claim" Email notification being received by you.
© Plastag Pty Ltd. All rights reserved.
Plastag, through Hyplast offers a wide range of films to cater for all needs and applications including;
A wide range of 3-layer co-extruded greenhouse films in different qualities, thicknesses and sizes are available.
A correctly chosen film protects your crop against negative external influences and creates an optimum microclimate for the specific crops.
Thanks to continuous scientific research, Hyplast is able to offer high value greenhouse films for all kinds of climatological circumstances and/or crops.
Properties available in the films include;
Thermicity - heat trapping additive to reduce heating costs.
Diffusion - controls the light transmission required, optimising plant growth.
Anti fogging - eliminates condensation build up, increasing light penetration.
UV - Blocking / Anti-Petal Blocking - avoid UV damage of certain crops i.e petal blackening of roses.
Cooling Effect - filter out Near infra-red 'heat' radiation. No longer necessary to ‘whiten’ the greenhouse or to use screens in hot climates.
Anti Dust - reduces dust build-up. Increases light penetration & ease of cleaning.

Resistance against Pesticide damage - Pesticides, especially sulphur and chlorine, containing ‘reacting agents’ can have a very negative influence on the lifetime of a film. Extend the life with this additive.
Film is available in 3, 4, 5, and 6 mil. Clear film as well as white opacities of 35%, 55%, and 70% are also available.
Widths from 4’ up to 60’ are available.
K3 IR/AC Long Life films – 3 years

Designed specifically for dutch venlo style houses. EVA resins produce a 3 year, 4 mil film that is super clear. Available in 14.4’ and 15.4' sheets and tubes, and 28.8’ sheets. Has patented AC additive.

A 4 year, 6 mil covering for single or double layer applications. Starting with strong EVA resin for excellent durability and light transmission, it comes standard with an anti-static additive to repel dust and dirt and keep the light shining through. Hyplast's UV protection uses the latest HALs technology for superior film life. Tri-layer construction gives maximum physical properties with less weight. Available in Clear or 55% White, sheet or tubes.

Keep the heat and lose the drips! Hyplast sets the standard in the industry for long lasting anti-condensation, the standard to which all other companies compare. All anti-condensates work when they’re new, but no other film’s anti-condensate additive keeps on working for you after that first or second year like Hyplasts' does.

Anti-condensation - Removes the condensation from the film surface by providing an industrial soap additive. That keeps the films surface tension low where droplets will not form. Water will spread out and “sheet” to the gutters.

Infra-Red - This film helps conserve energy by holding longer IR wavelengths in the house at night. This keeps the heaters from cycling as often and saves on energy. Has one of the highest thermal ratings of any film in the industry.
Diffusion – breaks up the light and spreads it around your greenhouse. Gives your plant even, cool light that can reach below the canopy.
Provides all the benefits of IR/AC, but has additional benefits.
Blocks harmful UV – while other films claim to block UV, most transmit up to 35% and some don’t block UV at all. KoolLite380 blocks all UV wavelenths to 380 nm.

Cools – by providing one of the highest diffusion rates in the industry and selectively filtering certain wavelengths of light that cause heat, KoolLite380 lowers leaf surface temperatures by up to 10 degrees. The result is not only cooler greenhouses and plants, but less water usage, less whitewashing in the hotter months. For retail environments, it means cooler customers and better quality light for the shopping experience, and for wholesale growers it means happier workers and staff.

Diffusion – KoolLite380 provides 77% light transmission, 75% diffused and 2% direct light. This means plants receive very high quality light that is even. Very little shadow can be noticed in a KoolLite380 house.

PAR quality – KoolLite380 lowers temperatures like a white film, but provides much better PAR transmission than a white film does. Good growing conditions result from the focus on blue and red wavelengths, and cool temperatures result from lowered IR wavelengths.
"A true revolution for open barn & free range piggeries, poultry farms and dairies - significant production gains."
Designed for anywhere where extra structural strength is needed.
Hytithermic – has a thermal additive that retards IR wavelengths, holding heat in your greenhouse at nights better.
Hytilux – has the patented Hyplast ac technology and IR additive.

We're a team who prides ourselves on our service. Doing business with us ensures you great service, price, quality and supply guarantees.  We are the partner for R&D plastic manufacturing company Hyplast from Belgium. Hyplast was one of the first producers of polyethylene grain bags and is the global market leader, producing the premium quality
Here at Plastag, our philosophies in business are very simple:
1. Offer quality, innovative products that add genuine value to our clients' business.
2. Ensure price guarantees every time. Being the direct link with the manufacturer, we can easily offer this.
3. Giving supply guarantees to our loyal business partners.
4. Exceptional customer service - in a timely and efficient manner both pre and after-sales.
All of the above is not possible without manufacturing partners that have the following;
1. Strong R&D departments to ensure 'innovation' is at the core of their business.
2. Efficient and state-of-the art manufacturing facilities and machinery
3. Good managers to deal with, who understand rural business and the volatility of the industry, more specifically, Australia's.
4. The flexibility and agility to 'defend' our position in the market place to ensure Plastag and our clients are sustainable businesses.
© Plastag Pty Ltd. All rights reserved.
© Plastag Pty Ltd. All rights reserved.
Quality assurance is paramount to the success of Plastag and Hyplast. Delivering a product that you can 'trust', underpins the continued success that Hyplast has had since its inception in 1975.

Careful material selection and innovative production methods are the key factors behind Hyplast, guaranteeing the success of the products produced. State of the art manufacturing facilities and quality employees, allow for flawless quality control. Further, all plastic undergoes 'voluntary' testing under the International quality control (ASTM) test. Don't settle for anything less.
Find out more by reading our quality assurance guarantees:
© Plastag Pty Ltd. All rights reserved.
As a Director of Plastag, Sam is involved in product development, importing, marketing & sales, distribution and relationship management.
Sam has a broad range of experience across the agricultural industry and throughout a number of value chains.
Previously, Sam worked for Elders Wool in Adelaide, then joined a private consultancy firm as an agri-business analyst.
Post Elders, Sam was the South Australian Sales Manager for Nuseed, then took a territory sales role with Pfizer Animal Health based in Victoria.
Sam completed a Bachelor of Agricultural Science degree and Master of Agribusiness before backpacking and working on farms around the world.
The family sheep and cropping farm is located in the west Wimmera region of Victoria.

Justin’s brings a wealth of agricultural retail experience to the Plastag team.  The former general manager of Kelly’s Group, and now as a partner in Plastag, Justin’s key role is to develop and service our strategic retail partners and assist in the commercialisation of new product developments.
Outside of Plastag, Justin is a prominent footballer in the Western Districts, and is the playing coach for Penshurst Football Club.
Rich is passionate about fresh food, interesting wine, sustainable agribusiness, innovation and communication.

He adds value to agribusiness with his breadth of experience in the agriculture, horticulture and wine sectors over 20 odd years.  Following his Bachelor of Agricultural Science at The University of Melbourne, he moved to South Australia where he worked closely with growers as an agronomist with E.E. Muir & Sons for 5 years in the South East, McLaren Vale and the Adelaide Hills.
Rich enjoyed the wine side of the business so much he went on to study his Masters of Oenology at The University of Adelaide and spent a number of years making wine in Australia and Germany.

Presented with the opportunity on Syngenta’s Technical Services Team, Rich spent three years working closely with growers, both horticulture and broadacre, to understand their business needs and best match these to Syngenta’s innovations.  Rich then joined BASF to manage the R&D program for horticulture and after 3 years decided to move into head office as BASF Marketing Manager for Australia & New Zealand horticulture.
Rich is excited to be developing opportunities with rural distribution in his role expanding the Plastag horticulture business
Roger has 30 years’ experience in the engineering plastics industry in Australia.
Having been the General Manager for Australia’s largest engineering plastics importer and manufacturer of stock shapes and finished machined parts in West Australia and Queensland,
Roger has a broad range of plastics experience in the agriculture, mining, mineral process and food manufacturing industries.
